title: Siro Pacenti 2012 Pelagrilli  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This opens with dry underbrush, sun-baked soil and French oak aromas. The palate is equally brooding, its dried black cherry and blackberry fruit brushed with licorice and espresso flavors. Assertive, close-grained tannins leave a firm finish. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Sokol Blosser 2014 Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: A pretty soft-focus wine, this opens gracefully with cherry lollipop fruit, accented with chocolate-coated orange peel. It's smooth, almost silky, showing just a hint of the granitic minerality that typifies this AVA. The wine spent 10 months in 42% new oak.

title: Tenute Silvio Nardi 2012 Manachiara  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Star anise, forest floor, mature dark-skinned fruit and a whiff of menthol perfume this structured red. The taut, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and pipe tobacco flavors, framed by firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Rendarrio Vineyards 2013 First Born King Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark in the glass, this blend of 75% Grenache and 25% Syrah is rich and appealing, made in the typical Paso style. Vanilla, cola, spice cake and black cherry aromas lead to a palate laden with milk chocolate, more black cherry, and star anise flavors. The tannins are soft and lush.

title: Vine Cliff 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Tightly structured in a ripe, bold bundle of cherry and berry flavors, this is an intensely tannic and youthful wine, clearly indicative of the vintage. Sage, dried herb, marshmallow and toasted oak aromas round it out, giving it flavor beyond its innate concentration.

title: Stone Tower 2013 Hogback Mountain Red (Virginia)
description: Woody notes of cedar and cigar box blend harmoniously with bright red currant and blackberry on the nose. Cigar box tones continue on to the palate, alongside flavors of black cherry, blackberry and Chinese five spice. The grippy tannins are well matched with crisp acidity and lush body, while the finish is long, dry and spicy.

title: Tolaini 2013 Montebello Sette Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this elegant Chianti has enticing ripe red berry, violet and baking spice scents. The palate doles out succulent black cherry, leather and clove notes, while firm, savory tannins offer support. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Capanna 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with subdued, earthy aromas suggesting used leather, grilled sage, Mediterranean scrub and mature berry. On the hearty, monolithic palate, a pronounced licorice note and alcoholic warmth underscore the mature black cherry and clove flavors. Assertive tannins provide a tight framework. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Carpineto 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Fruity plum aromas mingle with dark spice, chopped herb and violet notes on the nose of this full-bodied red. On the palate, fleshy black cherry, clove and anise flavors are set against chewy tannins and fresh acidity. It's already approachable but will also offer years of enjoyment. Drink 2018–2023.

title: Château Larose-Trintaudon 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: One of the largest vineyards in the Médoc and just outside Pauillac, this estate is also one of the most reliable. This vintage is finely structured with just the right amount of tannin to support the black and red-berry fruits. Fruity and juicy, it should be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2014 Les Hauts de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: This is the second wine of Larrivet Haut-Brion. It is rich with tannins and juicy with black-currant acidity. As befits a second wine, it is developing well and easily. Drink from 2021. While it shares the same name as Château Haut-Brion, there is no ownership or location connection between the two properties.

title: Château les Grands Chênes 2016 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This ripe wine is full of great fruit aromas and flavors. The tannins are generous and rich, supported by rounded black-plum and -berry fruits. It should cellar well through the medium term.

title: Château Mauvesin Barton 2014  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: A ripe full-bodied wine that has great structure and fine tannins. The bold red fruits are right to the front. It is a wine with great potential, generous tannins and the acidity of the vintage beautifully balanced. This wine will develop well. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Mazeyres 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe and generous wine, full of black fruits and ample acidity. There is plenty of tannic grip to frame the fruitiness. It is going to be rich, ripe and finely structured.

title: Château Peyrabon 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Owned by the Bernard family who also own one of the major Bordeaux negociants, Millésima, the wine is structured, deliciously fruity and with a series of smoky tannins that will allow it to age. It comes from a vineyard close to Pauillac and that shows in the dense Cabernet Sauvignon that gives the wine its weight. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Rahoul 2016 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine has delicious citrus and ripe green-apple flavors, as well as a crisp, lightly mineral texture. It is already showing its refreshing, crisp side that will develop.

title: Château Rahoul 2016 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This fragrant, juicy wine is full of black currant fruits and ample acidity. The structure is gentle, with sweet tannins that frame lingering notes of spice and black fruit on the close.

title: Château Rol Valentin 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a dark wine, solid in tannic structure and with great concentration. It has power that will express itself in rich fruitiness and firm tannins. This is a wine for long-term aging.

title: Clos de Beauregard 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. From a small property on the plateau of Pomerol, this wine boasts a power-packed mouthfeel of superripe Merlot. It is juicy, although the richness of the fruit is almost too much. It's for lovers of big wines.

title: Clos du Bois 2013 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino)
description: An intriguing oak spiciness on both the nose and the palate makes this medium-bodied wine interesting without overpowering the focused and vivid raspberry and red cherry flavors. The wine's texture is lean, braced by fine-grained tannins that give support and balance. Best after 2018.

title: D'Arenberg 2013 The Derelict Vineyard Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: The d'Arenberg style favors structure over plushness, even in Grenache. This is crisp and firm, its cranberryish fruit tinged with hints of raspberry, orange zest, cinnamon and clove. Give it a few years to soften. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Davis Bynum 2014 Jane's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens with the fresh liveliness of stemmy earth and black tea notes, growing funkier and more herbal on the midpalate. Brightly layered and deeply flavored, it's a full-bodied rendition that remains true to its variety.

title: DeTierra Vineyards 2014 Mesa Del Sol Syrah (Arroyo Seco)
description: This is a vibrant take on the grape, with fresh-pressed boysenberry and wisteria aromas merging with rosemary, fennel and sarsaparilla on the nose. Food friendly, it shows more boysenberry, thyme, white pepper, and floral freshness on the palate.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2014 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Spicy musky notes hover above scents of canned peaches. On the palate, these rich peach notes are framed by pleasantly bitter notes of pith and peach skin. The characteristic 2014 freshness makes this bright and sprightly and creates an off-dry finish to the concentrated palate.

title: Castello di Bolgheri 2013  Bolgheri Superiore
description: A blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 18% Cabernet Franc and 7% Petit Verdot, this well-structured red offers ripe dark-skinned berry, underbrush and graphite aromas. The concentrated, savory palate delivers black currant, white pepper and soothing licorice flavors and fine tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Château Balestard la Tonnelle 2016 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a beautifully ripe, fruity wine with juicy acidity and soft tannins. It is full of black currant fruits just lightly supported by the gentle tannins.

title: Château Bourgneuf 2014  Pomerol
description: This 22-acre property produces wines dominated by 90% Merlot. That gives ripe juicy red-fruit flavors, rich tannins and density. There is also a strong streak of acidity that shows vividly. The wine will soften over the next few years and give a delicious drink from 2021.

title: Château Cap Léon Veyrin 2014  Listrac-Médoc
description: This is a dense and tannic wine. It has plenty of the structure that is common to the Listrac appellation with a firm character when young; however, it also has swathes of ripe black fruits and acidity that will allow it to fill out very satisfactorily. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Clément-Pichon 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same ownership as Château la Dominique in Saint-Emilion, this estate continues to make impressive wine. With its subtle tannins and ripe berry fruits, it is structured while never letting the tannins overwhelm the fruit. It is an impressive wine to age, so drink from 2021.

title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2016 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a well-balanced wine that has ripe tropical-fruit and citrus flavors. Despite the warm, dry summer, it is so bright and lively, packed with fruitiness and crisp acidity.
